entry.title: Basics of borrowing
entry.content:
Basics Borrowing

  1. You are borrowing from future-self, not from a financial institution
  2. Credit rating is a great game by the banking community to make it easy to sell a loan to you
  3. You get a form-16 loan, they project your income and ensure that you have the potential to repay the loan. You will not get a loan for 1cr with 4cr downpayment at the age of 59, but you will get a good of 3cr with 30L downpayment if you are earning 30L/year.
  4. Should you borrow at all? Do good math before you borrow so that you do not regret it later. Ensure that you are able to retire with set goals. Do not over-borrow. always follow the 3, 20, 30, 40 rule for borrowing.
    1. 3 --> borrowing should not exceed 3 times your income
    2. 20-year loan EMI shouldn't exceed your take-home pay and 40% downpayment
  5. If you borrow at a younger age you will have less in your older age.

entry.title: How to diversify your assets
entry.content:
Asset Diversification

  1. Asset allocation describes how investment assets are divided into three basic investment types— stocks, bonds, and cash—within an investment portfolio.
  2. A total stock market index fund, for example, owns stock in thousands of companies. That’s a lot of diversification for one investment!
  3. Your goals are key criteria for asset allocation, for example, investing for retirement holds less stock and more bonds and cash equivalents as they get closer to retirement age. You may also need to change your asset allocation if there is a change in your risk tolerance, financial situation, or the financial goal itself.
  4. Rebalancing -->  is bringing your portfolio back to your original asset allocation mix. Rebalancing is required when some of your investment is out of alignment by the time. When to consider rebalancing your portfolio
    1. On regular time interval (every quarter)
    2. Only when the relative weight of an asset class increases or decreases more than a certain percentage that you’ve identified in advance. 
  5. Asset classes for diversification
    1. DEBT
    2. Liquid
    3. Equity
    4. Gold
    5. ETF / Index

entry.title: Investment rules I followed
entry.content:
Basic Rules of Investing

  1. Bank & NBFC are not good for the down-trend market. Best for the up-trend market.
  2. Stay away from speculative stocks
  3. ETF & Index fund is good only invest in ETF or Index fund where we have good liquidity.
  4. A long-term investment is best suitable for me.
  5. Keep watching where the smart money is investing and redeeming
  6. The average cycle of any sector is 9 month, below are the different stages of a sector
    1. Accumulation
    2. Distribution
  7. Read Option-Chain research paper
  8. Study Premium Decay
  9. Study Implied volatility research paper
  10. Backtest regularly
  11. Pick beaten-down stocks
  12. Mutual funds
    1. Evaluate platform regularly
      1. Demate charges
      2. Direct investment
    2. Raking --> Crisil & Value Research
    3. Invest in a fund with a large AUM
    4. Look for the expense ratio
    5. Invest in consistent performer fund
  13. Price is the most important factor in relation to the value. The price of a share represents part of the business. 
  14. Have patient stock don't go up immediately. 
  15. Patient and experience can't be taught you have to learn it yourself.
  16. But right and sit tight.
  17. Don't buy on tips
  18. Buy on a scale. If you have 5cr portfolio, making 5k or 5L investment no sense.
  19. Book some profit but leave something on the table, don't be all or none.
  20. Listen to suggestions from people you respect, it son;t means you need to accept them but at-lest learn, read, understand them and then come to your own conclusion.
  21. Try to be as emotionless as possible while buying a share first time. Emotions can lead to mistakes.
  22. Remember the work of compounding
  23. Prefer stocks over bonds
  24. Be careful of leverage, it can go against you.
  25. Rule of 72

entry.title: How to invest in a Mutual Fund
entry.content:
Mutual Fund

Turn Over Ratio

calculated as the value of all transactions (buying, selling) divided by two, then divided by a fund's total holdings. Essentially, mutual fund turnover typically measures the replacement of holdings in a mutual fund and is commonly presented to investors as a percentage over a one-year period.

ETF VS FOF

  1. FOF’s offer a unique option of diversification by investing in other mutual funds.
  2. While ETFs can be traded on the stock exchange, they tend to offer better returns over the long term.
  3. ETFs are passively managed funds, on the other hand, FOFs are mutual funds designed to cater to the needs of investors who prefer actively managed funds.
  4. ETF have higher liquidity as traded in market during market times
  5. EFT is cheaper than FOF. There are some FOF where the difference is very less for the long term.
Taxation: FOF are taxed as debt funds regardless of the schemes they invest in. 

Short Term Debt Fund

  • Check standard deviation, low standard deviation represents the more stable fund
  • Invest in a fund where the majority of securities belong to AAA or AA
  • The sharpe ratio of the fund represents a better risk-adjusted return. A ratio of 1 or better is good, 2 or better is very good, and 3 or better is excellent.
  • Higher alpha high returns
  • Invest in the fund house backed by a bank.

Liquid Fund

  1. Liquid funds are alternative to a saving account, not to FD.
  2. NAV movement of the scheme follows a straight line is a good sign for liquid fund
  3. Liquid funds are also risky
  4. Invest in a liquid fund where AUM is high
  5. Choose a liquid fund whose portfolio is highly diversified with more securities.
  6. Choose a liquid fund that allows you to insta cash facility.
  7. The liquid fund invest majorly in 3 types of instrument
    1. Commercial paper
    2. NCD
    3. Certificate of deposit
  8. If commercial paper exposure is more than 5-10% then it is a high-risk fund.

Tips

  1. Do not invest in same type of fund, not over-allocate
  2. Bet on the fund manager, the fund manager is a key aspect to look for a mutual fund investment
  3. Look for the turnover ratio of a mutual fund, a higher turnover ratio is not good for a fund, it shows that the fund manager is not confident enough on their choices.
  4. Keep different accounts for family members and use different investment strategies with each family member. Choose investments based on your investor profile.
  5. Try not to stop SIP
